text:
Note that selecting a "product" is not applicable to my problem - but I couldn't get to this screen without picking something.

I am trying to query a database I should have access to.  I was asked to "raise a BUG ZERO" in order to gain "access to ETL database instance".   I am using SQL in Microsoft Visual Studio and getting logon rejection for access to the following:
Server:  sv3570\v2d811
Data Base: GrpQPSConv1_dv.dbo

In Visual Studio 2008, I click on tools from the menu bar and click on "Connect to Database".  Then I enter databse and server names.  For "log on to the server", I use either radio button "User Windows Authentication" or "Use SQL server Authentication" with my uy22 id and RACF password.

Either way, when I click on "test connection", I get "Login failed for user US\uy22
creator: margot.hosford@sunlife.com

text: I don't understand how possibly this has to do with Rivet.

text: close this bug. It should be filed against the Apache HTTP webserver
